data.text: 2/2024 update did NOT fix...Devices don't show up in the list and my Google Home Hub says no cell phone linked to your Google account! I use this feature even around my house all the time, but it suddenly stopped working. Used to work seamlessly. Samsung 23 Ultra. Device is shown on Google play. Now doesn't work at all. Checked location settings including location history, updates, Find My Device is turned on and every setting as suggested in forums. No fix for this FAIL!

Great concept and but not accurate! I thought I lost my phone and the app showed me where it was last detected. It was a location I had never physically been ever, in the opposite direction of my travel. I figured someone had found it then turned it off. I logged out of my Google account on the device and tried to factory reset it remotely. I found the phone in my recliner at home! Charged it, turned it on and it was in the same condition I left it in - signed into my Google account and all.

3 times the phone's location in complete error. If you have thgis problem once, it may be time to upgrade or troubleshoot. Best approach is to let the phone ring in all familiar possible locations. This it does - but after that it does not give a reliable location - off by as much as 10 miles but within the history of travel. May be certain phone types - as I see others have no problem, others have this exact problem - the wild goose chase effect. Two stars for being free and ringing the phone.

After latest update, all my android devices have vanished from the device list. The screen shows no devices. I have used this for a long time as I am notorious for forgetting where I left my phone. Just opened it up on my tablet and all of my devices were missing. I eventually found my phone, and when I opened Find My Device, it initially listed all the devices, but then wiped out the list and it is now blank as well.

It was working fine all the time just until today this evening. All of a sudden, now my devices are no longer showing or listed. and it's telling me that there are "No active devices". Had to clear the storage on install and then reinstall it again just to see if my device's would to will appear on the app. Had to to also go extenxed links by restarting my phone just to find a resolution. Nothing! So if I lose my phone that I'm screwed. What is going on here?

I just love this app! I can locate any of the four devices we have: 2 phones and 2 tablets. They can make a sound (unless the sound is turned off), and then I request the location. I then get details to follow. Many times, there's at least one device in the car. I get directions using the Map app, so I can walk straight to the device. Once it had fallen out of my backpack and was mostly covered by leaves. The sound and turning on the device screen helps us to walk to where it lay!

The "What's New" section is unhelpful in showing what's actually new, so I used the occasion of a loved one getting a new phone to see how reliable this app is. Fortunately it works for locating, using sound. Also fortunately, they kept their old phone. Because if you only have one device, this app is barebones and you can't test it. Would be helpful if users can test the setup, and put the web portal front and center instead of behind Settings (maybe even put it in the app description here).

One problem... The phone you're looking for could be off and this app still allows you to click the "play sound" button and acts as if it is able to communicate with the list phone and tells you it's playing a sound on the lost phone when actually it is not. If the list phone is on and has a connection and location services enabled then it works fine. Otherwise, it would be nice if it told you it is unable to communicate with the lost phone.

It allows you to find or secure or erase devices remotely under your account. It's password protected too to prevent unauthorized access. One of the few Google apps on Android wear. However, there are issues: 1. Unnecessary recent icon update to confuse me even more with other Google apps. 2. It will add all mobile devices to all accounts signed in, only way not to do that is remove the account. 3. Practically no configuration settings.

This app has helped me several times. As long as you stay updated you'll be good. When I did end up needing to use the app, it was so simple and quick. If I had to make a recommendation, then I guess the only one I have is this: a good feature I would like to have also, is when we're given the option to wipe our data and lock our phones, if it could take a photo or even better a quick hand full of pics before locking the user out. Still I give this a very rare 5 stars. üëç

This app doesn't seem to be working for me. None of what people describe or what the photos show in app store appears on my screen when I open the app. It just shows me my phone's name and then when I click on it, it goes into the settings for that one in the app. I see no location on a map, I don't see any option to play a sound or lock my phone etc. I tried uninstalling then reinstalling.... nothing

my phone has been missing for a month and it shows in the same areas. I see where UT is but it keeps moving and I have to refresh it by tgen it's way somewhere else. it says location is off when it's obviously on, sometimes it won't work at all , sometimes it'll work then while I'm trying to go follow the phone it stops or won't refresh or says location unavailable, or no internet. sometimes one email won't work to locate the phone but the other one will. ect. I can keep on and on and on.

Super easy. you log in, and all linked devices under your account are on a list, ya pick the one you lost, play a sound to find it, boom. Very helpful. Very fast.Didnt try the location aspect but that's always going to be approximate. Kind of useless if the device is off or if the battery dies, no one wants to be paranoid waiting hours or days for the device to come back on and be locatable,but does what I need for my clumsy around the house mishaps for devices.

Why does this not have 5 stars? This works great! I tested it out, and it worked. I tried out all the features like the alarm and message. It worked great. Even when my phone was dead, it still located it. Obviously it will not sound an alarm when it's dead, but hey you get the location even when it's dead. Very good job Google, this is extremely helpful like your many other apps.

The basic functionality of this app if okay, I guess - but even though it's RARELY updated, they truly need to fix some annoying issues and allow for real-time tracking as well (or an option to turn on/off). My biggest complaint with the recently updated version is that I can no longer lock a phone. They changed it to "secure device" but that's utterly useless. The previous version guaranteed me to lock a device. This one, for some reason, no longer does that! Please look into these suggestions guys, and add/change them accordingly. We all know it's possible, just gotta take that next little programming step.

Thank goodness for this app! Was sure I lost my phone on the subway train. I didn't have this app installed, I just thought Google was somehow able to find it through GPS or something. It found nothing. At first I assumed it was because the phone was between stations and didn't have a signal at the moment. Finally,  I realized I needed to install this app and hoped it would work when (and if) the phone came back online. I desperately kept refreshing my browser looking for an update, then BAM! The phone popped up on the map a few blocks away. I wasn't expecting that. the phone wasn't moving so I hoped that meant someone turned it in somewhere. I raced to that corner and started asking around. Sure enough someone turned it in at one of the stores I had been in. Turns out I didn't lose it in the subway after all but accidentally dropped in the ice cream freezer. What a relief!

Awesome app! Very helpful, I'm very grateful for it. In fact... If I didn't have this app, my phones would be long gone.. Rip. Doesn't contain any ads from what I can tell, very pleasant and easy to use. Tells where all the devices are, their percentage, when they were last seen, and it has a custom thing for securing your device and making it say a certain message when someone finds it. Very reccomended for people who lose their phone a lot, like me.

App worked for years, but now regardless of redownloading, restart tablet, restart app, defrag... literally everything and for no reason the alarm that sounds when I've misplaced the tablet will randomly play... and play until I touch the screen. Again, I did everything multiple times and it continues. EVEN after it had been deleted for 2 days blamo! Weeks later and finally it's gone from my life. I had to figure out how to truly delete any trace of it. Stupid issue!

The app--perfect; user--not so much. My search was limited to inside the house, its usual place. So since I heard no ring, working theory focused on the failure of the app { soft sound, technical glitch..} Then, I searched the map on the app. Max zoom-in revealed a distinct outline of the house and the phone outside the structure and in direction of my parked auto. My phone was ringing loudly inside vehicle.

Doesn't prevent people from shutting off your phone, doesn't save location when the battery is low,before shutting down, or upon startup, unless you have wifi connected. Doesn't even actually secure your phone & if the person knows your screen lock, securing is a waste of time. Erasing is less than helpful as it makes it so you can't track your phone! Rather than just FRP locking it like it should do. Overall, this app is completely garbage and unhelpful.

This used to work great, but its become completely pointless. One of the biggest points of this app is being able to remotely ring a device if you cannot find it (eg it fell in a couch cushion, left on a shelf, whatever). But at some point in the last 6 months or so, it stopped working reliably. I finally figured out why. If your device is in DO NOT DISTURB, and "alarms" are blocked, this will not work - at all. This is completely stupid. This app requires device admin permissions, and it somehow cannot bypass do not disturb? This makes absolutely no sense, and it completely nullifies any usability of this when its needed most. Phone in do not disturb? Can't call it to locate it. That was ALWAYS the point of this app for me. And now that doesn't work AT ALL, unless you specifically allow alarms as an exception. There are times when you literally want EVERYTHING turned off, but you want this ONE thing to actually work, and now it doesn't do that any more. Maybe its not the apps fault. Maybe its because of stupid changes google made in Android 10. Either way, its broken, its useless, and I'm probably going to be done using pixel devices as a result.

My husband lost his phone & really thought it was somewhere in our house. I installed this app & it indicated that it was actually about an hour from our house, in the vacinity of where he had been earlier in the day. Find My Device didn't put us in exactly the right spot at first but after refreshing a couple times, we could see we were in the right spot. When we still couldn't find the phone, I used the "Play Sound" feature & there it was. Someone had thrown it in the garbage! Thank you!

I just happened to be looking for my phone which I misplaced. I usually look for it by using The computer and located that way. I just happen to pick on the wrong you URL and it sends me to this. so I downloaded it. this is absolutely worthless. just like somebody else said no sound can be played at all. it's able to locate the phone. in fact, I had the phone right next to me and tried to play the sound and was not able to do it. no update since November 2018, Will utilize computer to locate,

Very convenient very easy to set up and log into from a different device if you have lost your phone. Very accurate on location and cool options where you can lock your device or wipe your device or make it to where you can have it set off a loud sound so you can find it as well! I have used this app with every single phone I've had since this app came out. Very very helpful!

My password that I set for my phone doesn't work. You have to enter it twice and it's the same password I use for my google account so I know it is correct. They let you know very clearly that there is no going back once you set the password so I wrote it down. It won't unlock my phone. I've tried every variation of possible typos that I could have made twice in a row (unlikely) but after so many erroneous attempts, it draws out the length of time between tries so it takes forever to keep trying. I e-mailed the address listed on this application current as of 4/26/2020 and got an automatic reply that I have reached an e-mail account that is no longer monitored, but it is still listed on this application. I will now have to wipe my phone clean. Lose all of my baby pictures, all of my contacts, everything. DO NOT DOWNLOAD THIS APPLICATION.

If the device has been signed out of the Google account, already been factory reset, or has been damaged, this is completely useless. HOWEVER, it does work well as long as the app is installed on the device you're trying to locate and the afore-mentioned issues don't hinder it. I'd suggest that a 2nd PIN setting could be added in this app to prevent factory reset of the device or the uninstall of locator app before its found. I use a free app-locker now, which seems to be effective so far. ü§ûü§û

This needs to have a setting in the app that allows you to turn on location to the lost device remotely. I don't like to have my battery drained by having location on all the time, so being able to turn on location remotely would be a big improvement for this app and features and would still allow you to find your phone even if you have location turned off when you lost it.

Very very awesome app. I felt that the content on my phone was secure until it was back in my possession. I just wish it wasn't so easy to remove the lock that I had set from another device. while using the app to lock it, it had also informed me that to remove the lock, all I had to do was click the power button once. So if someone clicked the power button while on the lock screen they could easily be back onto my phone's lock screen. Also the live view of it's maps is YEARS outdated.

Pointless app! Here's why: In order to find your missing device you need to sign into your Google account. Makes sense so far. In order to sign in you put your password in, then need to do 2 step verification. This is where the problem is, you need your phone to verify it's you on this step. How, if your device is missing, do you do this? Your stuck, Google help apologies for the inconvenience but there's no way around it.so don't bother downloading this pointless app.

As soon as I downloaded it I went to log in with my Google info. And after that it showed me all my devices that were connected, I could choose which one I was looking for it also showed where it was , and i could send a sound signal, which it actually made a sound when I did it. The phone I was using it also showed I had it in hand,, I was surprised because most apps don't work. But thus one is legit. Try it and u will see. Very happy. Thanks

Not working! I used this just a few weeks ago and was able to pin point my phones location along with make it ring (with a toddler around it came in very handy often!) Suddenly it's telling me "no active devices". thankfully I have found my phone, I've tried to update the entire phone reconnect everything and its still not working. Why is there no way to contact a live person through Google to help. I'm really disappointed. I hope others find this out before the device is lost.

By far one of the better location apps I've ever used, and I've used quite a few. Does exactly what it says it does. You can remotely wipe a device - and yes I've tried that before and it works. You can locate a device on the map and it is extremely accurate. You can also make the device sound off by ringing. Very easy to use, intuitive. No ads of course. This device is best used when given Admin Privilege in settings.

Well designed - being able to sign in as a guest from another(s) device is revolutionary Brilliant! I had lost my phone under the bed we could not find it anywhere under the bed I even looked on the sides of the bed. I was expecting an important and could only locate it while it was ringing in lighting up and did not have the time to sign into or set up my account on someone else's device. It was in between the rail the bed and the bed itself, then covered up by a sheet. Thank you Google!

It's cool you can find your device and gives options to lock it, erase it, make it scream. But what about the ability to turn on the mic and record or the ability to turn on the camera and record that way you have a recording of the person whom stole it along with their face and what they are wearing, not only would this come in handy if it were stolen but would be helpful say someone was kidnapped etc. Also you should be able to export all current text messages their content, files, etc.

This app is awesome. Until your device is stolen and you inquire for the location and it flashes in great big huge letters across the screen that the location is being accessed by a remote user. Way to go Google. Way to protect the culprits privacy. Wh don‚Äôt you just go ahead and turn location off and unlock everything about the device for them.  At least I would have a chance at getting my phone back. The location would stay on then.

I'd give 5 stars, but lately, the app shows no active devices. Now, that is a huge issue for me ,not only for the obvious reasons. But when I was robbed at gunpoint and all my belongings were taken, had it not been for the find my device app the criminal would have gotten away with it, but by tracking my phone the criminal was captured and now in prison. So you see, this app does amazing work with more than I initially expected. I have tried every possible fix the internet had to offer but no.

I used this app to find out where my fiance was going because I had suspicions that he was cheating. It was very accurate, no time delays, and I love that I can click on the link to Google Maps or Google Earth for more detailed information. I tried using the Google Maps Timeline feature, but its very confusing, no explanations that I understand, and it overlapped my timeline with his timeline. I highly recommend this app over all other tracking apps!

This is the easiest app to use for a lost device! I can remotely lock my device & put a message on the screen saying how to get in touch with me or I can remotely erase everything off the device, which is an awesome tool to me! As long as the device is on w/ mobile data or wifi than it shows you the last location, the date,time,etc of where your device was at last. And u can also have it make a noise in case it's right in your area & once you find it super easy to unlock & get back into your de!

I think this is a fantastic app. The only thing I think it needs is a way to be able to locate your device if your rate plan hasn't renewed and the phone has no wifi connection where it is lost at then you are beat and can only find its last known location. I know the last known location and it isnt what google says (yes obviously i know im out of minutes and the phone has no data connection) and thats why im suggesting a way of locating a lost or stolen device that has no connectivity.

Without fail this app has located, retrieved and locked at least 6 phones I have has over the years. Most recent i had left my phone at an apartment complex and this app allowed me to track my phone to a Walmart 5 miles from the complex. I sat in my car as i "play sound" and i watched someone attempt to remove my non removable battery in an attempt to stop the 5 minute ring tone. Spectacular! This should be on everyone's device administration phone list.

Great app. Best to install, test it to make sure all your devices are connected to it BEFORE you really need it. Great to find your misplaced phone in the couch or car via the computer too. I have my old phones that I use for YouTube cast devices connected to it also. They are excellent for finding my misplaced working phone in the house through this app.

It gave an approximate area but still helped save the day. Someone picked up my girlfriend's phone and she didn't notice it was gone for about 30 minutes. We were at an amusement park, so with the approximate location we knew it was around a certain ride. We asked the exployees at the entrance and exit, no one had seen it. I finally looked inside the garbage can half way through the entrance queue and there it was! Thanks to Find my device we were able to retrieve the phone.

People are using the web portion of this to track people down in about 5 minutes. My account is compromised that my location is visible to anyone that has my email account. I've changed password and it still isn't protecting me. Needs better protection than what's in place in order to keep it from going on. Your website shows the last location but the app doesn't show that info. I've gone as far as turning off the find my device button which isn't right. Web needs to be like app.

This is definitely an app I always install when I get a new phone. I test it every once in awhile using my PC and my wife's phone to locate it. There have only been just a few times over quite a few years"Find My Phone" couldn't locate my phone right away. Eventually it always did. I like to have a backup option for things like this. My paid security suite covers our PCs, and has Android and IOS apps too.

this is a great idea that has been made totally useless. This only works if you are PLANNING to lose your phone, lol. first off, the "alert sound" does not play, so that's pointless if you are at home looking for the phone... next, the location, wifi and data ALL has to all be turned on. How it should work: I should be able to go to my Google account on a COMPUTER, LAPTOP OR TABLET and then use this to find my phone, erase it or make it ring. very simple idea.

This app is virtually worthless. Trying to find my friend's phone for them and it requires 2 point authentication by sending a code to the phone for verification....the lost phone. Dear programmers....I don't think you understood the assignment. SMH. This is only good for finding your own devices or to find a friend's devices other than their phone. You'll have to use a computer for the find my phone feature.

It works! My phone was picked up on the side of the road 10 minutes from home. I returned to look for it within 5 minutes and found nothing, so I went home got another phone, lucked upon this app, apptly named, downloaded and installed it. Immediately the location showed up on the app map and 10 minutes later I was standing by the woods where the app indicated the phone was within an hour after I lost it. I screamed out, to the possum or raccoon, that might have picked it up a reward offer.

I absolutely love this app. I have had to use it twice now where both phones (that were not mine) were stollen. The device location was on for the first phone so I played sound and secured the device while leaving a phone number. Thankfully, the person that took the phone called and I was able to retrieve. The second phone did not have location turned on but I played the sound and was able to locate. The person that took it returned it back to where they found it. We recovered the phone.

When I install the app on one phone, I also want to add other phones and tablets in my household. This app does not enable that function to add more devices unless they already exist in the recognized devices. I only saw one to add and I needed to add three more, so there should be a + button to add more devices. When I use my laptop, I should be able to see all of the devices and their locations.

This app hasn't always worked. But it's either the update or something but the last couple of months when I have needed it, it actually does what it says it will do and my phone ACTUALLY RINGS EVEN WHEN ON SILENT, which I found not to be the case for the past however many years I have NEEDED and not found it to be helpful. FINALLY, it got its kinks worked out, for the moment at least.

This app is very convenient, but I wish it had more features like being able to remotely turn your device on if it was turned off after being stolen. If someone takes your phone and turns it off, you'll only be able to see the last location of it before it was turned off. After that, the only thing u can do is send messages to or wipe it clean. Once u wipe it clean, this app will be useless for that phone. Puts u in a messed up predicament once it's stolen and turned off

Everytime I log into a pit saying no active devices however the devices aren't lost their actually in my hand. I check to see if the following was on and they are: location, Wi-Fi, Data. I am able to use the website and see the devices, just not I'm the app. I have tried to uninstall and reinstall the app and nothing has changed, please help!

This is a lifesaver- I pretty regularly lose at least 1 of my phones and either of the Google sites/app are super easy to use, have never failed me. I think one of the coolest abilities it has is to make it ring even if you have it totally silenced or on vibrate, because you can't always count on finding it by it lighting up, especially when it isn't dark outside. And of course just because when you have it on silent calling it repeatedly does nothing - A genius & extremely helpful bonus.

find my device was awesome several years ago. you could literally watch real time footage of your device moving down the road if in car. now days you are lucky if the device even finds your phone and if it does find it, it isnt always accurate (like by 45 miles off). most of the time it gives a "last seen" time that was 1-3 hours earlier. That has proven to be redicoulous and ineffective for us. if my phone is missing i need to know where it is currently, not where it WAS 3 hours ago.

Extrememly useful app for smartphone users. The most important thing that must be stressed to most people who use this app is to make sure you've granted this app permission access your phones location. This app has really cool features ranging from calling that device, showing you the general location of where you may be able to find your missing device & create secure folders which prevents others from being able to access your mobile devices content. Even the ability to erase all data.

I lost my phone in the city of all places. Find my device was able to locate my phone and maintain it's moving location playing music so I could find it. Because of the music the person who pocketed my phone must have got nervous and decided to drop it and leave. When I found my phone it was right on the sidewalk with the music playing loud so I could find it. So thank you very much Google Find My Device. This is an amazing app.

I've used this app more than once. Really like the Make Loud Noise and remote lock functions. Also used to locate device but note that both location, and when it was there, can be inexact. Google maps and GPS may only indicate nearest wireless router (in one case I knocked on a door across the street from parking lot where phone actually was).

Many times, this app helped me find my phone. Having this protection is such a relief and so simple to use through another trusted device. Usually, I misplace my phone. But with the GPS system this app uses, I am able to simply see it on a map and go right to it. Even when my phone was stolen once, I was able to locate it 5 miles away, to the exact apartment it was taken to. Being able to recover that loss,, was an amazing feeling. Now, the 1st thing I do, with a new device i install this app.

The one super important time I needed to use it it didn't really help since it appears that I lost the device about a quarter of a mile away (it came out of my pocket while motorcycling about 1/4 mile down the road after I had done a turn and had been destroyed by traffic) and didn't spot it until a week later even though I had searched the reported area and for a couple hundred yards further on. It seems that the check in time needs to be improved, especially when the device is moving fast!!!!

We have multiple accounts and when we switch accounts it says there cannot use the account and the only option is to quit. Press the quit button and it goes to the previous page and tries to reload... causing an infinite loop. Horrid experience and the only way that I found to fix it is to uninstall it. I have no ideal how this app was able to be released into the wild

This app is awesome, while it's used it will pinpoint the exact location that it is in! When you loose it or left it somewhere and simply forgot about it, Even if someone stole it and turned it off to not get caught, or so they think haha üòÜ, you can remotely turn it on (with your friends phone or spouse's) and get the location it is in and I mean THE EXACT SPOT, this app has saved me from having to buy another $500 to $600 phone! I recommend this app if you've ever had this happen to yourself

Actually, Find My Device's UI isn't intuitive at all. If you're a complete tech newbie, it's rather frustrating and not user-friendly at all. Sharing location on Google Maps is way easier. It's easy to use and understand, aside from showing the present location it also gives turn-by-turn directions.

This app is very useful if the settings are equipped properly. If you misplace a device without it's location turned on, then it's utterly hopeless. In the case that your location is turned on.. a world map appears, according to your phone number area code, and generates it's location. The ability to lock your phone from another device is the best feature and your allowed to add your whole family into the owned devices category to recognize when the phone is connected to the internet or not also

Find device has worked in the past but no longer does. It would be quite inconvenient If ever lose my phone because it doesn't show up in the app or the web portal. I've cleared the cache. The app has all the necessary permissions and find my device and location are on. haven't changed any settings, it just stopped working one day. It says no active devices. I have a pixel 6 pro FYI

I have updated this from 2 stars to 1. I have Google One and reached out for help. They are failing to address the very absurd reality of this app. In particular, if you have 2 factor authentication, then you need your lost phone to be able to find your lost phone. How messed up is that? Embarrassing for Google, really. Anyone have any recommendations for a 3rd party app?

My phone is missing the status on the app is "Can't reach" meaning the internet connection is down. Makes a lot of sense considering the phone is probably off. So it would be nice to get a last known location. The app says the phone was last seen on this date so there should be a location with that. Location on the phone is enabled as i used google maps as some point also it wouldn't say last seen on todays date if it weren't on... The app is garbage.

Good but - location is iffy. I'd like to be able to turn on the location setting for "all the time" but this does not seem to be an option. Consequently, if I'm trying to find my device through the website - the phone will ring, but only the large map of the US will show on the computer screen - not the phone's precise location UNLESS i also happen to have the app open on the phone when I lose it.

Definitely helpful. I've found several lost or even stolen cell phones and other devices. Only an idiot would steal anyone's personal devices with the tracking and GPS abilities there days! This app will turn on the volume and show you on a map where it's at while contacting it! Been using this app since 2011 and it's only gotten easier and better to operate.

Still haven't found any one phone that was either stolen or left somewhere that is forgotten. Once the phone is turned off there is never another contact with the device. Somehow to improve this app there should be a function of the app that saves enough power to ping a location even with the location off and device turned off. There is no way to find a device that is off I realize. But there should be an option since that is usually the one way a phone is forever gone.

I have yet to have used this specific Google application recently, however my friend had to use it to locate her Motorola Edge (2022) that was lost somewhere between my home and her car and it was pretty damn accurate. Given it was 2am and a lot I mean a lot going on and it was vital that we find her device as quick as possible. The Google "Find My Phone" application was pretty damn fluid, responsive and accurate in regards of the location, the notifications and the sound alerts ‚ÄºÔ∏è

This app has saved my butt a time, or two. The reason I can't give a good review is because if you're searching for a lost phone, two factor authentication should be over ridden. If I lost my phone, and am trying to find it, does Google really think I can press yes on my (lost) device to verify that I'm signing in? I'm not trying to gain access to any part of my account, other than being able to find my device. I, now, keep myself signed in on multiple devices to prevent this issue, but still...

Update: started working only after looking for it on a laptop! Uodating from 1 to 3 stars! OP: Doesn't work on Android 11. Requests permission only to access location when app is open. No special permissions, nothing! Doesn't sound any sound or notification when contacted from another device, It's just offline! All the info I get about the device's location is from maps timeline history. Ugh. Works fine to find my older Android 8 phone though.

Horrible App. After installing it on a few phones I decided to take one phone off. When I did that the app completely erased my phone and SD card. EVERYTHING was lost, photos, contacts, messages. That wiped my phone without warning. Had my phone been stolen the thief would have been able to have a new phone since it was set to factory reset. I would not recommend this app to anyone and now I can't get it of my other phones for fear it will factory reset them.

It appears to work exactly like the website except that it looks better. I used to have a Chrome link to the website on my homescreen. Now I have a link to this app. It meets expectations. For people with two-factor security who give this one star because they cannot find their phone, set this up and test it BEFORE you lose your phone. You may have to set the app to not prompt for password or just use the website on a trusted computer.

Update (8-5-23) Very glitchy & sporadic when locating devices. Says can't find the device & it's right next to the phone. Today (2-10-23) I noticed a major update. (I have the Samsung 22Ultra) Not sure I like the update. Requires a lot more clicks to get where you want to be. I'll give it 3 stars for now. Today just started saying "no active devices" when I know there are! How do I fix this?

Google find my device works extremely well as long as it's set up correctly. I strongly suggest that you make sure it is set up on a second device and test it from the second device to make sure it is fully functioning as it should. My pixel 4A was stolen last summer down in San Bernardino I immediately tried to log in to secure my device and I was unable to. It would show me where it was last seen but that was it and somehow my Google pay and many other apps were compromised.

I used this awesome service last week, and we were able to track my boyfriends phone back to where we had been previously sitting outside a restaurant. Someone had actually turned his phone into the hostess. The only problem we ran into was the person who found the phone turned it off so right before we got there it stopped showing the location, and had it not been where we last were we may of not have found it so easily. Amazing app! So grateful!

data.userName: Try me I'm Already a Ghost
data.text: Works excellent. Have had my phone lost and stolen. Tracked it down and when I got close used the make device ring to see exactly where my phone was. The guy who stole my phone had it hidden in a backpack and denied he had it till I made it ring. To developers: the one downfall is if you don't happen to always have your phones location on (which drains the battery faster) "just in case" you can't track your phone. If you could make it so a person can remotely turn on location would be perfect

It is impossible to delete a device off of your "find my device" app without deleting the actual phone itself. It automatically syncs to whose phone you used and it connects the phones together: contacts, apps, emails, everything. The point is to be able to find your device, not lose all the information on another one.

This app is totally useless. I've used it twice now & didn't find my phone either time. If the phone is not connected to wifi it gives only its last connected location. No matter if you lose your phone or a sticky fingered thief gets it, they can be rebooted as if no one was using it. I think there should be an app that you could just simply fry the lost phone. Well maybe in the future!

The first and only time I've ever lost my phone... Apparently that's exactly what happened after you party way too hard the night before! Only to wake up the next day without a clue as to when, where, and how I lost everything in my pockets, wallet and phone included! Ugh!.. This app came with my phone brand new and I never thought I'd use it. Well I did and to my surprise, it freakin worked perfectly! I had the location and then my phone back in hand within an hour of using the app.

If location was off its useless. Advertisers etc know where your device is by the wifi or mobile signal you're using. Other models of phones can find a device without location. Maybe they could use a push to turn on the location? But no. Nothing if location is on. The battery wasting barely usable Google location. Pretty useless app in a common circumstance. If location is off you can't even remotely data reset your phone.

Of limited usefulness. No location history. If you don't know the device's currently location, don't you think it would be helpful to at least know it's last known location? I could've sworn either the webpage or this app used to show the history, but I guess they had to remove it because it was too useful. And it only seems to find the device under certain ideal conditions. It only found 2 out of 3 devices for some reason.

works ok most of the time. I can't track all my phones, only part of them that loaded on set up. no way to add the others. over all a decent app. need to allow adding other phones to it. Now it is saying more and more, location not available or it shows where they were from 1 to 35 minutes ago. It also show them where they were when I know they are not. Uninstaller and reinstalled many time now and works for a day or two and back to the same stuff. I will be looking for something else.

What is going on with this app? I have relied on this for years, and love this app for the simple feature that it will show the level of the battery charge of the phone remotely. For the record, I *hate* USB-C connectors. This one app was the saving grace for my phone type due to USB-C charging connector being so finicky. Well, I also kept my faith and trust in the locking feature and the wiping feature. But today tested the sound feature to find the device, and no sound is coming from either of the devices I'm checking out today (June 11, 2021 Friday). Get this fixed, and make it available on EVERY android device, even the pseudo-flavored android devices. Because of the failure of the make a sound option, I give just four stars, otherwise I'd go all out with five stars. Oh, added comment: you can use this app to check your phone battery level from a computer online, if you're logged in. Check it out.

Sound is very faint. Google Fi support told me there is nothing they can do. All media, notifications, and phone ring are loud and function normally. Find my device is so low it's impossible to hear when more than 10 feet away. It used to work well so this is strange. Clearing Cash, Storage, and reinstalling did not fix the issue.

Awesome, theft spoiler! I've found it very useful plenty times. Yep, once, two years ago I dropped my phone at a bar and had it on silent without lock screen and we left. Hours later at home I realized it was missing and traced back to the nightclub in their office and they denied that it was found. I made it ring and locked with a message to them and they tried to turn it off, but in the end they gave it back.

Highly accurate app for determining the location of a device through Google account services ‚Äì so you must have a Google account signed in from your device, and your location on, for the app to work. Very appreciated, but my automatic sign in feature fails every time I use the app, so there's an inconvenience in having to sign in manually as a guest every time. Also, I don't see a way to set the device as "found" after having located it, even though it says it's "in my hand."

I don't know when this happened or why, but the app turned off the ability to locate my phone unless it's fully unlocked. This makes it useless when I'm trying to just ring the phone from within the same room if I misplaced my phone under a blanket or it fell behind a couch or something. There's also no setting to change this. Undo this change please.

EDIT, 10/27/2020: I AM A DUMBASS: I JUST HAD TO TYPE "google find my device" into the search bar of my chrome & it began to look for my device! Upgraded from 4 stars to 5. This app is wonderful in theory, but it lacks one thing in execution: what if the phone this app is on is the only phone you personally have? That makes the app useless. It would be great if there was a similar app for your laptop (if you don't have a tablet) to remote lock your lost phone. That would be immensely helpful, and Google should have thought of that and made it readily available. But I shall see if such an app exists, because I want an app like that for my laptop to remotely lock my phone in the event I lose it. i live on 70 acres of land. While I don't lose my phone easily, I still live on 70 acres of land, so losing it is likely.... and I can just go, boop, note it missing on my laptop, track it on my laptop, and not interrupt the work of my family members. 4 stars.

I installed the find my phone app on my tablet because I misplaced my phone, somewhere in my house. I usually keep the ringer turned off, so I couldn't locate it by calling it. I had searched throughout the house repeatedly, but could not find it. I knew it was nearby because my bluetooth earpiece was still working. After installing this app, it connected to my Google account, and brought up both my phone and my tablet. Played a loud tune, and I instantly found my phone!

It found my device, twice left behind, once in a rideshare vehicle, secondly in a shopping venue. I will always keep this app when storage on device is low. Before having this app synched with notebook/tablet, Ive had devices come up missing, with zero recourse. Now I feel secure in that I can set off ringer; shut down, lock screen, put a message on screen for who to contact..etc. Or wipe contents. Great app.

Fantastic App!! Lost my Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra phone for 3+ hours; looked for it EVERYWHERE - downloaded this app on my Galaxy S8 Tablet which is connected to my phone and literally within 40 seconds had my phone make a sound and I found it in my daughters room! Hilarious! Last place I thought it'll be. Bottom line, fantastic feature. Easy to use & super spot on! Thanks for this!

I'm so thankful for this app! Because of it, I was able to retrieve my phone that was on the side of the road 6 miles away from me (left it on someone's bumper.) I also love that you have the option to erase the phone remotely, in the worst case scenario. You can even type a message with your info to be seen on the lock screen or play a sound if you go looking for it. This is a wonderful feature to have. Thanks again!

I had this app installed on my tablet when it disappeared from my home. I was unable to find out the last location before the tablet was turned off and date was incorrect because I had used it myself after the date given on the app. Every attempt to get help or contact the developers only circled back to the same useless screen informing me that you were unable to contact the device. I tried to secure it and I tried to leave a message on the locked screen and haven't a clue if I was successful.

This is a nice app when it works properly, but the latest version has a bug wherein a transition from a Wi-Fi network to a 5G network is not reflected in the connected network name unless the app is completely restarted. The app continues to reflect the Wi-Fi network name after the transition to a 5G network with a different name. Hopefully this will be fixed in the near future.

Can't even connect to the device when I am using the app on said device. Can find my other devices just fine, even without the app being on them, but not this one. Not sure if it's the device or the app, but I would hold off getting this till they fix the issue with certain devices. Edit: It says on the device is located, but on the app it says it's not connected.

It does just what it says. This app quickly and effortlessly locates a missing device. I've had phones stolen lost you name it and each time this app brought me right to it. I like the features where you can leave a personal message on the screen lock the phone up or just wipe it all together. Great app. Easy lay out easy navigation.

This app has come in handy many times! If you can't remember where you put your phone you can use one of your other electronic devices to find it. I love that it'll play sound till you find it. The only thing I wish was better was that when my Samsung J7 goes missing it would play sound on it. For some reason it doesn't. But the app does show it on the map and when it was last used.

My wife loses her phone all the time. This was our saving grace. Now that the sign-in process requires two-step authentication it is useless. She can't click anything on her phone when she has lost it and borrows mine to find hers. There needs to be an exception made for this service-- where it will locate the device with just a password, but require two-step authorization once the device is found and used. This is terrible oversight by Google.
